column1: Over $130 billion in Paycheck Protection Program funding remains unused and could go towards helping businesses. Small businesses & workers in #IL18 need help to withstand further impacts from COVID-19 and state-mandated closures.  #LetsWork to help American families. https://t.co/uXdcOnnQv0

Congress needs to act to pass my bipartisan CERTS Act ASAP. Businesses like @PeoriaCharter and their workers can't withstand further impacts from COVID-19 and state-mandated closures. The CERTS Act will extend a lifeline for small businesses so they can survive. https://t.co/v6T2fB1roU
More positive news on a COVID-19 vaccine. This development shows tremendous potential and is a testament to the hard work supported by Operation Warp Speed. https://t.co/vMX43nWF0n

Legislation that I introduced – the Restoring Access to Medication Act - passed this year to help with COVID-19 expenses. My bill allows over the counter (OTC) medication to be HSA eligible. Learn more: https://t.co/0PFAzujqnQ

At Nucor’s American Buildings in El Paso I toured the steel facility & spoke with workers about the impact of COVID-19 trade & infrastructure. Their Made in America steel helps provide good-paying jobs in central Illinois & I want to thank Nate & his team for the warm welcome. https://t.co/Dn5mBamhHP

Great to join the Washington Rotary Club over lunch at Countryside today to discuss issues related to COVID-19 our small businesses and the economy. Thanks to Mayor Gary Mainer Stephanie Deiters and Kristi LaHood-Cape for the warm welcome. https://t.co/TWqOhJndmz

Washing your hands with soap is an effective way to slow the spread of COVID-19 and keep your loved ones safe. On #GlobalHandwashingDay we reaffirm our commitment to promote health and good hygiene.  Read more about our efforts on the WASH Caucus: https://t.co/ju9WEAQt4X https://t.co/y4YWiAlJ8B

Thanks to the Hancock County Farm Bureau and the Hancock County EDC for hosting me this week to discuss trade ethanol and the impact of COVID-19 and state-mandated closures on the region. Congress must continue to work to provide relief and reinvigorate our economy. https://t.co/6R7uV1Tic0

In Springfield today I spoke with @JordanElderTV about the #ChinaTaskForce final report and getting additional COVID-19 relief to small businesses and families in central Illinois. Watch the full discussion on @wics_abc20. https://t.co/37HtZN1XL9

I joined @USGLC yesterday to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on #IL18 communities national security and the Illinois economy. Thanks to the U.S. Global Leadership Coalition for their work to strengthen American diplomacy.https://t.co/20CVpWiWSr

Continuing to support access to quality coordinated healthcare with providers hospitals caregivers & patients is critical in our fight against COVID-19 & to lower healthcare costs. I joined a bipartisan group to urge Congress to address a timely challenge facing ACOs. https://t.co/i7NmQouwgM

Quincy is blessed to have a great healthcare community. I visited leadership at QMG & Blessing Hospital to get feedback on COVID relief. I also saw the ongoing projects at each organization that will improve healthcare options & further Quincy’s first class medical community. https://t.co/iB35E0FYkW

In Springfield today I spoke with @JonHansenNews about getting Illinois workers safely back on the job reinvigorating our economy & additional targeted relief for workers & families in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch the full discussion on @wics_abc20. https://t.co/jcEpW7NOdb

I visited Manito Trucking to talk about the need to authorize a long-term infrastructure bill & industry-wide initiatives to recruit & train drivers. Thank you to the truck drivers who are delivering products & keeping our supply chain moving during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/GHRsG1jqvx

Thanks to JBS for investing $2.5 million in the Beardstown community as part of their Hometown Strong Initiative. This funding will help respond to needs resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic and strengthen Beardstown's future. https://t.co/PM2Lo2U8t2

In central Illinois cutting edge research & clinical trials are helping our country’s effort to find a COVID-19 vaccine. I spoke with @PeoriaChamber & the @USChamber’s @globalIPcenter to discuss the innovative work our medical community is doing in #IL18. https://t.co/aF13QQejsR

Thank you to Adjutant General Neely of the @IL_Natl_Guard & Colonel Carpenter of the 183rd Air Wing in Springfield for an update on the 183rd’s mission & their COVID-19 relief support. I will continue to support the men & women who serve in the Air National Guard in Congress. https://t.co/smKn5GbC7w

I joined the @PeoriaChamber @globalIPcenter & medical professionals to discuss innovative research happening in our hospital systems in central IL as part of the national effort to find a COVID-19 cure. We also talked about protecting US innovation from IP theft in trade policy. https://t.co/grY8KFJvi9

Great to visit with Adjutant General Neely of the @IL_Natl_Guard Assistant Adjutant General Nezamis & Colonel McDonough of @the182AW in Peoria for an update on the 182nd’s mission. The Guard played a key role in our COVID-19 response & I’ll continue to support them in Congress. https://t.co/KFk9HUYPsr

Thank you to the @mcleancochamber for having me this afternoon to provide a #StateofCongress update with @RodneyDavis. We had a good discussion about the COVID-19 impact on McLean County small businesses and the challenges they face in our recovery from the virus. https://t.co/YOwKK5QLEn

It was great to be in Macomb yesterday for move-in day at WIU and to visit with the McDonough Co. Hospital personnel. I will take what I heard back to DC to ensure west-central Illinois continues to get the resources we need to combat COVID-19.  https://t.co/rA18TqvS69

I want to thank @WesternILUniv President Abraham & his team for the campus tour & highlighting all of the new safety protocols implemented in response to COVID-19. I was impressed with WIU’s approach & want to wish them all the best as they start the school year. Go Leathernecks! https://t.co/6GiThGry2A

Global Impact Innovation & Big River Resources in Galva started making ethanol-based hand sanitizer in March to help combat COVID-19. They hired 20 additional people & the innovation holds great potential for midwestern ethanol. We are grateful for the investment in central IL! https://t.co/4X6ROOOhBs

I recently joined @WITA_DC for a discussion about US-China relations my work on the #ChinaTaskForce & trade. As America works to recover from COVID-19 strengthening our global competitiveness through trade is critical to rebuilding our economy. Watch⬇️ https://t.co/H0UyVnC6qz

It was a great morning at the 111 Coffee in Wyoming! I heard from constituents in Stark County about the need for increased rural broadband funding and financial support for small communities schools and law enforcement in the next COVID-19 relief bill. https://t.co/2qGglOTdpQ

Hardin Industies Inc. is expanding their manufacturing operations in Lacon bringing 65 news jobs to Marshall County. As we work to recover from COVID-19 this is great news for Lacon that will spur economic opportunity. https://t.co/do24NbRSa0

Community Health Centers play a critical role in keeping our communities in #IL18 healthy particularly now as they protect us from COVID-19. Last week we celebrated #NHCW20. I am proud to support the work they do to provide affordable and reliable healthcare to IL residents. https://t.co/BJTJSX1qNj

As we work to recover from COVID-19 Congress can take important steps to support food and beverage distributors their workers and their customers impacted by this pandemic with the PLUS Act. Read my op-ed with @IFDA:  https://t.co/Q97I3nGd7l

It was great to be in Quincy this week to visit Kohl Wholesale and discuss the PLUS Act which will support food and beverage distributors their workers and their customers as we rebuild from COVID-19. Read more from @WGEM: https://t.co/pnK8A5HKsM

In Beardstown I enjoyed joining Mayor Leslie Harris to hear from city leadership and residents. We discussed the impact of COVID-19 state-mandated closures and the importance of infrastructure in Cass County. https://t.co/iQNCgBC67D

Thanks to Kohl Wholesale in Quincy for having me to discuss my bill the PLUS Act and tour their facility. Food distributors like Kohl ensure our food supply chain stays strong. The PLUS Act will allow distributors to continue supporting customers as we rebuild from COVID-19. https://t.co/W2gw2sehiU

Salons & barbershops have been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19. My bipartisan legislation will provide these small businesses relief as we work to reinvigorate our economy.  Read more from Paola at Five Senses Spa Salon & Barbershop in Peoria ⤵️ https://t.co/CgZH4qOoxP

In Jacksonville today I sat down with @wldsnews to discuss COVID-19 relief my visit to Morgan County reinvigorating our economy and many more issues. You can listen to and read our conversation this week at https://t.co/4mfCQHQuRn. https://t.co/agzq0izt9e

The economic impact on Peoria from COVID-19 & state-mandated closures is being felt across our community. Pleased to announce that $1.4 million in CARES Act funding is being directed to Peoria to support businesses & workers during this difficult time. https://t.co/lNwO0l5CVW
I joined Joey McLaughlin on @WTAX this week to discuss the new regulations on youth sports the importance of telehealth and COVID-19 relief.  Listen ⤵️ https://t.co/5eJHm7SKsa

I continue to hear from local leaders in #IL18 who are struggling because of COVID-19 and Governor Pritzker’s stay-at-home orders. Congress intended for this federal relief money to be disbursed to those in need. Not to be withheld by Governors.

The lack of transparency regarding federal COVID-19 funding sent to Illinois from @GovPritzker is unacceptable. Congress & the federal gov't sent $3B+ but only 14% has been utilized. The Governor must immediately provide information on how federal taxpayer money is being spent.

Spoke with @BrianMackey about a variety of issues including additional COVID-19 relief our economic recovery the new rules for youth sports in Illinois and more.   You can listen to our conversation at 11 am central ⬇️ https://t.co/aCgXmV6BvQ

Given the COVID-19 pandemic now more than ever the government should do all it can to promote certainty and economic growth. That's why I joined some of my Illinois colleagues to urge the Army Corps to speed up maintenance of the LaGrange Lock and Dam ahead of the Fall harvest. https://t.co/dou1gpFbvb

Listen to my discussion from this morning with @BishopOnAir on @NewsTalkWMAY about COVID-19 relief my Clean Start legislation that will incentivize a safe return to work and the developments in the federal corruption investigation that implicated Speaker Madigan ⬇️ https://t.co/f8F2aDUy7k
Joining @ScottMillerShow on @WJBC at 7:10 am central time to provide a Washington update and discuss COVID-19 relief. Listen ⤵️ https://t.co/jXasBoOF7J

COVID-19 has severely impacted Illinois food and beverage distributors. I joined @RepJimmyPanetta today to introduce legislation that will help distributors keep their employees on the payroll and protect our food supply chain. https://t.co/COdeluAELY

Thanks to everyone who joined last night’s telephone town hall! We had a productive conversation about COVID-19 and issues that matter to constituents of #IL18. If you would like to participate in future calls you can subscribe here: https://t.co/xStfeS7ZNG https://t.co/hn0qsrRjxQ

Great news for @ConnectTransit! This week @RodneyDavis and I announced that over $930000 in CARES Act grant funding was awarded to support Bloomington-Normal's public transportation system in the wake of COVID-19. https://t.co/FT13ZH2D0G

This week I joined @USIP @nancylindborg and my fellow co-chair of the US-China Working Group @RepRickLarsen for a discussion on the current US-China relationship human rights Hong Kong trade COVID-19 and more.  Watch our full conversation ⬇️ https://t.co/zMtLzXWmLE

Salons and barbershops have disproportionately impacted by #COVID19. My bipartisan commonsense legislation will provide these small businesses needed relief during this difficult time. https://t.co/dezra4gkC2

#USMCA will create more opportunities for #IL18 farmers manufacturers and workers. It will provide needed certainty for our ag producers and create jobs—which is critical for our #COVID19 recovery. https://t.co/H7H8rh3gL0
I joined @MarkMaxwellTV for yesterday’s @CapConnectIL. We discussed the #COVID19 response the #PaycheckProtectionProgram police reform efforts in DC and more.  Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/AXpn9LLrIX

This weekend I met with my #IL18 Veteran Advisory Board to discuss priorities facing our veteran community. We had a good conversation about the impact of #COVID19 on veterans suicide prevention awareness health care & veterans’ services. Learn more: https://t.co/qxwbKbCwbM https://t.co/7O919Gk1P2

Joined the Ways and Means Subcommittee on Select Revenue Measures for a hearing on tax relief to support workers and families during #COVID19. We must focus on incentivizing a safe return to work to put our country back on strong economic footing. Watch: https://t.co/LoHWxOyboN https://t.co/fzYY2EXWro

Important: the #PaycheckProtectionProgram application deadline is June 30th. This program has been a lifeline to small businesses across Illinois during the #COVID19 pandemic. If you need assistance learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/kvQRxzeSrf

China presents us with a unique challenge because of #COVID19. As we look to the future we must strengthen our supply chains and build off of the Phase One trade deal to increase competitiveness. Learn more from my discussion with the @RiponSociety about the #ChinaTaskForce ⬇️ https://t.co/zBZnREb2J9

My shoes haven’t looked this good in months but they do now thanks to Peoria’s own George Manias. For 74 years George’s Shoeshine & Hatters has been a staple in Peoria but #COVID19 closed his shop. It’s great to see him back in business.  Nobody does it better than George! https://t.co/UZY0WqXFue

I had the pleasure of joining @PSimonInstitute this week for their #UnderstandingOurNewWorld series. We had a great discussion about state & federal politics #COVID19 response reopening our economy IL's fiscal challenges fair maps & more.  Watch ⤵️ https://t.co/JOTihFgB91

Illinois must deliver #COVID19 federal aid allocated for small rural communities in need. Additional funding from Congress should go directly to cities & municipalities instead of being routed through states who have circumvented Congressional intent. https://t.co/dF9oLK6bnl

Getting folks back to work is critical to reinvigorating our economy. I've cosponsored @RepKevinBrady's back-to-work bonus proposal that will incentivize the temporarily unemployed to return to work. This will help Main Street rebuild in the wake of #COVID19. https://t.co/cqIvYWMhBk

#COVID19 & forced shutdowns are threatening the jobs of first responders & firefighters like those in @AFFI1935 & @pfdlocal50. That's why I've called on FEMA to give greater flexibility to SAFER grantees so experienced firemen & women can keep their jobs. More from @WMBDNews ⬇️ https://t.co/wbDn3Mm5ic

Chip’s Handyman Service is fighting hunger and giving back to the Jacksonville Food Bank in wake of #COVID19.  Thanks to Chip Williams and his team for helping those in need during these difficult times. #InItTogether #HeroesUnmasked @journalcourier https://t.co/iWSc6LDT8a

It's unacceptable that Illinois continues to withhold federal #COVID19 aid from municipalities in need. Smaller rural communities need help too.  That's why I joined my IL GOP colleagues to call on Gov. Pritzker to provide transparency about where this federal funding is going. https://t.co/WpJTJhQFu3

The threats against communities fighting to save their livelihoods in the wake of #COVID19 are unconscionable.  I agree with @NikkiHaley & @standamericanow. We should empower local leaders who balance the health & economic needs of their towns not harm them with top-down fiats. https://t.co/ZyDOF82jAt

It is deeply troubling that during a global pandemic & in the middle of an economic crisis that House Dems took an unserious approach that puts their political agenda over #COVID19 relief. Congress must focus on providing bipartisan assistance to those in need. Full statement ⬇️ https://t.co/a0UpxEfdiZ
Joining @wgnkingjohn on @WGNRadio at 10:15am to discuss #COVIDー19 and Congressional action to provide relief for Illinois. Listen ⬇️ https://t.co/4vISmSH276
Joining Joey McLaughlin on @WTAX at 6:45am this morning to discuss #COVIDー19 and our recovery efforts. Tune in ⬇️ https://t.co/z73DZY6FzC

GOOD NEWS → @FTA_DOT is sending $10.2M+ in #CARESAct funding to the @CityLinkPeoria for #COVID19 recovery. This will ensure residents have access to safe public transportation and that workers get the proper equipment to stay safe. https://t.co/mjK0gY0alo

Looking forward to joining @rap30 for @SundaySpin on @WGNRadio this evening. I’ll be on around 6:30pm to discuss the impact of #COVIDー19 on downstate Illinois our response and how we recover.  Tune in: https://t.co/PgFuXe6xek https://t.co/MLCnsaxr2O

Honored to be named by @GOPLeader to @HouseGOP’s China Task Force. It’s important that we hold China accountable for mishandling #COVIDー19. I look forward to doing just that & being a strong voice for American workers & farmers on critical trade issues. https://t.co/C2hlF8p4Vk

#COVIDー19 is putting an incredible strain on Illinois pork producers gutting their market. That's why I joined my Illinois Republican colleagues this week to urge the Governor to seek available assistance from @fema for our pork producers.   https://t.co/OVmnLRmd8m

Nurses in Illinois are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response keeping our families and communities safe.  On #NationalNursesDay I want to say THANK YOU to all of #IL18's nurses! https://t.co/wPk9v51Vzt

On #TeacherAppreciationDay I want to say thank you to educators across central and west-central Illinois. #COVIDー19 has forced our schools to close but that hasn't stopped Illinois teachers from educating students in new ways.  Thank you #IL18 teachers! https://t.co/LcJ4u9ZJ7o

#COVID19 didn't create IL’s pension crisis & taxpayers shouldn’t be on the hook to bail out decades of fiscal mismanagement. IL needs real reform & Congress should focus on helping everyday Americans.  My conversation with @guypbenson on @GuyBensonShow  ⬇️ https://t.co/KXPqVtl5LK

Congress should be in DC doing the People’s business not sitting on the sidelines while essential workers fight #COVIDー19.  @GOPLeader @RodneyDavis and @TomColeOK04’s safe reasonable plan to get Congress back to work is the right approach. https://t.co/Bw7q8BHZtg

As we work to combat #COVID19 in Illinois we must take an approach that balances the health and economic needs of individual communities. I spoke to @WMBDNews over the weekend about the need for a safe phased and regionally focused approach to reopening Illinois. https://t.co/yeNwSTkeNe

I joined @NewsTalkWMAY with @BishopOnAir and Chris Murphy this morning to discuss the extension of Illinois' stay-at-home order the need to begin regionally safely reopening our state and the next steps Congress may take in the fight against #COVID19. Listen ⬇️ https://t.co/zfzzQv37ym
📺 Coming up at 4:05 pm I’ll be on @WMBDNews with @eugenedanielTV to discuss #COVID19 and the need for a safe regional and tiered approach to reopening Illinois.

Illinois is a regionally diverse state and #COVID19 is impacting downstate differently. That's why I joined @RepKinzinger @RodneyDavis @RepBost and @RepShimkus to call for a safe regional approach to reopening that meets the health and economic needs of individual communities. https://t.co/gsATDNudrp

#COVID19 impacts communities differently. How we reopen our economy in Illinois must recognize our regional differences. The City of Quincy & Adams County's "Road to Recovery" developed by health experts & leaders is the model for safely reopening. https://t.co/U4ceyDjVXZ

Pleased that #CARESAct funding will support Public Housing Authorities across west-central Illinois in #IL18. With this funding PHAs impacted by #COVID19 can support management and resident services.  More from @WhigNews ⬇ https://t.co/3FhLNieflm

Good to join @SteveScully last night on @cspanwj to talk about #COVID19 in #IL18 the federal government’s response getting Congress back to work and a smart safe reopening of our economy in downstate Illinois.  Watch from @cspan ⬇️ https://t.co/8XWaH6LZYw

GOOD NEWS: @HUDgov will be sending over $1.8 million in funding to #IL18 Public Housing Authorities. This important funding will help PHAs in central and west-central Illinois impacted by #COVID19 with management maintenance and resident services. https://t.co/m4KaUl7FsB
At 10:40 am I'll be on @WGNRadio with @wgnkingjohn to discuss the latest on #COVID19 and our response. Tune in ⬇️  https://t.co/4vISmSH276

Great to see @hellocountry helping out their customers during the #COVIDー19 pandemic! With fewer drivers on the road this will help central Illinoisans get through this difficult time.   Country Financial to refund 15% of auto premiums @Pantagraph  https://t.co/jFyd3QF2NX

Left the house at 4:00 a.m. and drove to @fly2midway so I can get back to DC to vote on #COVIDー19 relief for small biz through the #PaycheckProtectionProgram our hospitals and expand states’ capacity to test.  Thanks to the staff at @SouthwestAir for keeping everyone safe. https://t.co/7IGbf6VkQf
The IRS will be holding a webinar for small businesses and workers tomorrow April 23rd at 1 pm to answer questions about #COVIDー19 relief.   More information ⬇️ https://t.co/GuJRzYajlO
#ICYMI: @Walgreens opened a #COVIDー19 testing site in Springfield this week. To learn more information about getting tested go here: https://t.co/wrUn9ELh9m  https://t.co/l7kuSU0J6Q

Decades of bad policy caused Illinois’ pension crisis not #COVIDー19. I will continue to support funding for Illinois to combat this virus & recover but Congress shouldn’t bail out Illinois’ fiscal mismanagement. We should be helping everyday Americans. https://t.co/VEu3XT7VLu
I’ll be on the Greg and Dan Show at 8:40 am to discuss the #COVIDー19 response and the next steps for Congress. Tune in @1470WMBD ⬇️  https://t.co/jr35WsFIrv

I joined @RodneyDavis @RepTimButler and Rep. Mike Murphy this morning to visit the new @Walgreens #COVIDー19 testing site in Springfield which will bolster testing efforts in central Illinois. To learn more about getting tested click here: https://t.co/Il8aFWe7MF https://t.co/F4dpQlx27Y

Thanks to @StateFarm for its efforts to provide customers relief during the #COVIDー19 pandemic. Fewer folks are driving right now and this credit will provide support through a challenging time. Great to see Central Illinois companies #InItTogether! https://t.co/NyzamaMGNn

Great news for @PeoriaCharter! Thanks to the #PaycheckProtectionProgram they can bring back staff who were furloughed because of #COVIDー19. #PPPloans are helping small biz across our country and this will bolster the Peoria and central IL community. https://t.co/l1YYOzGrXg
Spoke with @KHQA yesterday about the impact of #COVIDー19 on west-central Illinois and federal efforts to support our response. Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/aalTErbWDR
Thank you to Peoria’s @the182AW and the servicemen and women of the @IL_Natl_Guard who are working day and night to support the #COVIDー19 response! https://t.co/vQ15k3ceOz

At 8 pm I’ll be on @WTVP for another live At Issue Coronavirus special with H Wayne Wilson. I’ll be answering questions about Congress and the federal government’s response and the impact of #COVIDー19 on #IL18. You can watch on @WTVP or Facebook: https://t.co/1bOMLvUJQl https://t.co/BXjyojMEdx

Joined @RodneyDavis today to visit the #COVIDー19 testing site in McLean County.   We are pleased to announce that the federal government intends to extend its support & funding for this pilot testing site through May.  Thanks to @SecAzar @HHSGov @McLeanHealth & @IL_Natl_Guard! https://t.co/nhki6BBRgA
At 7:40 am I am going to join Greg and Dan on @1470WMBD to provide an update and discuss #COVIDー19. Tune in ⬇️  https://t.co/YfgRQzzzBX
On #WorldHealthDay I want to say thank you to the brave health care workers in Illinois on the front lines of the #COVIDー19 response. https://t.co/PP2E0FK2vW

As we confront #COVIDー19 we are seeing Americans rise to the occasion to help. I was happy to lend a hand to ensure they can start ASAP. Converting portions of the plant to produce hand sanitizer will help our response & could hold great potential for the ethanol industry.

GOOD NEWS: Global Impact Innovation will begin producing ethanol-based hand sanitizer at Big River Resources in central Illinois in response to #COVIDー19 ramping up to 100k+ gallons per month. https://t.co/Ix2fAiTEC4

Now more than ever the work respiratory therapists do is vital to the health and safety of our nation. Thank you to Illinois respiratory therapists on the front lines of the #COVIDー19 response. https://t.co/FXWOmP367a

Black Band Distillery's grand opening was delayed because of #COVIDー19 but that hasn't stopped them from lending a hand to help those in need. Now they're working to make hand sanitizer for our frontline responders. #InItTogether #PeoriaProud https://t.co/2R3QLH9Kjn

I applaud @POTUS and his Admin for acting to ensure Social Security retirement and disability beneficiaries receive automatic coronavirus relief payments. Seniors need relief and this will make it easier for them to receive their checks and eliminate unnecessary paperwork. https://t.co/PLFOfYRlbf
Thanks to @CaterpillarInc for stepping up to support Illinois’ #COVIDー19 response efforts! #InItTogether  https://t.co/4pzIAZuBWh
Important update and information from @WaysandMeansGOP ⬇️  Avoid Scams and Schemes Tied to Coronavirus Relief Checks. https://t.co/PgRzqjaIM2

Joining Quincy's @930amWTAD for today's News Round Table around 10:15 am to discuss the #COVIDー19 pandemic the impact it's having on west-central Illinois and the #PaycheckProtectionProgram. Tune in ➡️ https://t.co/I63JoBF2vw https://t.co/bq16MCKUf8

Important relief funding from @HUDgov allocated by Congress is coming to central & west-central Illinois. In #IL18 Bloomington-Normal Peoria & Springfield are all receiving federal funding to support the #COVIDー19 response. More from @Pantagraph ⬇️ https://t.co/nFA7pA7Nbf

Pleased to announce that funding allocated by Congress in the #CARESAct for @HUDgov is coming to #IL18 to bolster #COVIDー19 relief.  This funding will support low-income areas local infrastructure projects small biz assistance & homelessness prevention. https://t.co/nPR6fkHuiU

—@IL_Natl_Guard members from @the182AW and the 183rd are on the front lines of the #COVIDー19 response and testing in Illinois.  I’m grateful for their service and willingness to keep our communities in #IL18 safe during this challenging time. https://t.co/WHG8d4Z7F5

On @WGNRadio with @PeteMcMurray yesterday we discussed the #CARESAct which was enacted on Friday and what it means for families workers hospitals small businesses and more impacted by the #COVIDー19 outbreak. Listen ⬇️ https://t.co/n4dMdhPVDN

At 1:07 pm I’ll be joining @PeteMcMurray on @WGNRadio to discuss the #COVIDー19 outbreak its impact throughout Illinois Congress’ response efforts and more. Tune in: https://t.co/4vISmSH276 https://t.co/OjSqiaJjLZ

Thanks to @SecAzar & @HHSGov for their efforts to expand testing & support Illinois’ #COVID19 response.  The new testing site at the McLean County Fairgrounds operated by @HHSGov @IL_Natl_Guard & @McLeanHealth will help our fight to prevent the spread. https://t.co/nUwRnOlm8k

Like every obstacle we face Americans are rising to the occasion to combat #COVID19. That’s what we're seeing in #IL18. The heroes among us—nurses doctors health care workers truck drivers grocery workers & pharmacy clerks—are stepping up to support our communities.
I spoke with @KHQA yesterday to provide an update on the Congressional response to #COVID19 and the #CARESAct. Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/8TnrjuRrQ6
I’ll be joining Greg and Dan on @1470WMBD at 7:40 am to discuss #COVID19 Senate passage of the CARES Act and what’s next. Tune in: https://t.co/f935jvTEiF

On @WGNRadio today with John Williams I discussed the phase three coronavirus relief bill and what it will do for workers families small businesses and hospitals across Illinois impacted by the #COVID19 outbreak.  Listen ⬇️ or ➡️ https://t.co/RI83ua2VKh https://t.co/0DkxRRiRp6

In recent weeks I supported funding for health care workers on the front lines of the #COVID19 response. I applaud @POTUS & @HHSGov for awarding federal $$ to #IL18 CHCs. This will bolster our efforts & resources to combat the coronavirus. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/Pu7pgB2mPx

Hosted a call with several members of the General Assembly from #IL18 to discuss #COVID19 response at the federal level. I appreciate their work to help our community during this difficult time & feedback as we finalize Phase III relief.  Working together we’ll overcome #COVID19 https://t.co/aY9XxTEwEK
